intro: Platyaechmea chantinii, commonly known as the red-tipped pineapple plant, is a striking member of the Bromeliaceae family. It is native to Mexico and is characterized by its rosette of dark green, sword-shaped leaves with red tips. The plant produces a striking inflorescence that resembles a pineapple, with vibrant red bracts surrounding small white flowers. It thrives in warm, humid environments and requires well-draining soil. Platyaechmea chantinii is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and relatively easy care requirements.
